skill.name: agent-tools
skill.description: Run 150+ AI apps via inference.sh CLI - image generation, video creation, LLMs, search, 3D, Twitter automation. Models: FLUX, Veo, Gemini, Grok, Claude, Seedance, OmniHuman, Tavily, Exa, OpenRouter, and many more. Use when running AI apps, generating images/videos, calling LLMs, web search, or automating Twitter. Triggers: inference.sh, infsh, ai model, run ai, serverless ai, ai api, flux, veo, claude api, image generation, video generation, openrouter, tavily, exa search, twitter api, grok
skill.summary: Access 150+ AI applications through the inference.sh CLI platform for image generation, video creation, LLM calls, web search, and more.
skill.author: inf-sh

security_audit.summary: All 182 static analysis findings are false positives. This skill provides documentation for the inference.sh CLI tool - bash code blocks are instructional examples, not executable code. URLs are documentation links. The pipe-to-shell pattern is the standard installation method for CLI tools. No malicious code, prompt injection, or security threats detected.

content.user_title: Access 150+ AI Models from Your Terminal
content.value_statement: This skill provides access to the inference.sh CLI platform, which lets you run over 150 AI applications without requiring local GPU resources. Generate images with FLUX, create videos with Veo, query LLMs like Claude and Gemini, perform web searches, and automate Twitter posts through simple bash commands.
actual_capabilities: Generate images using FLUX, Gemini 3 Pro, Grok Imagine, and other models
Create videos with Veo 3.1, Seedance 1.5, and Wan 2.5
Query LLMs including Claude, Gemini, Kimi, and GLM through OpenRouter
Perform web searches using Tavily and Exa search engines
Automate Twitter/X actions like posting tweets and following users
limitations: Requires installation of the inference.sh CLI tool and authentication
Some AI apps may incur costs depending on usage
Network connectivity is required to access the inference.sh API
Not all AI models are free - some require paid API keys

use_cases.title: Generate AI Images for Content Creation
use_cases.description: Content creators can generate custom images using FLUX or other models by running simple commands like 'infsh app run falai/flux-dev-lora --input='{"prompt": "a cat astronaut"}'

use_cases.title: Automate Research with Web Search and LLMs
use_cases.description: Researchers can combine Tavily web search with Claude LLM calls to gather and synthesize information efficiently through CLI commands

use_cases.title: Build AI-Powered Workflows
use_cases.description: Developers can chain multiple AI apps together - for example, generate an image with FLUX, upscale it, then create a video from the result using inference.sh apps

prompt_templates.title: Generate an Image
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the inference.sh skill to generate an image of [describe image] using FLUX. Show me the command and explain how to save the result.
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to create AI-generated images

prompt_templates.title: Create a Video with Veo
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a video using Google's Veo 3.1 model through inference.sh. I want a [duration] video of [description]. Show the exact command to run.
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to generate AI videos

prompt_templates.title: Query Claude via CLI
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the agent-tools skill to send a prompt to Claude Sonnet 4.5 through OpenRouter. Ask: '[your question here]'. Display the response.
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to access LLMs through CLI

prompt_templates.title: Search the Web and Summarize
prompt_templates.prompt: Use inference.sh to search the web with Tavily for '[search query]' then use Claude to summarize the results into a brief report.
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to combine web search with LLM analysis

output_examples.input: Generate an image of a sunset over mountains using FLUX
output_examples.output: I'll run the FLUX image generation model for you. Command: infsh app run falai/flux-dev-lora --input '{"prompt": "a sunset over mountains"}'

output_examples.input: Search for recent AI news and summarize with Claude
output_examples.output: Running Tavily search for 'recent AI news'... Results found. Now querying Claude Sonnet 4.5 to summarize the findings...

output_examples.input: List all available image generation apps
output_examples.output: Fetching image apps from inference.sh... Found 42 image generation apps including FLUX, Gemini 3 Pro, Grok Imagine, and Seedream 4.5.

best_practices: Use 'infsh app sample <app-name> --save input.json' to generate and save a template input file before running apps
For long-running tasks like video generation, use the '--no-wait' flag and check status later with 'infsh task get <task-id>'
Run 'infsh app list --category <category>' to discover apps in specific categories like image, video, or text
anti_patterns: Do not run apps without first checking their input schema using 'infsh app get <app>' to understand required parameters
Avoid passing complex JSON directly on the command line - save to a file instead to avoid shell escaping issues
Never hardcode API keys in scripts - use the INFSH_API_KEY environment variable or 'infsh login' for secure authentication

faq.question: What is inference.sh?
faq.answer: inference.sh is a CLI platform that provides access to over 150 AI applications including image generation, video creation, LLMs, and search tools without requiring local GPU hardware.

faq.question: How do I authenticate with inference.sh?
faq.answer: Run 'infsh login' which opens a browser for authentication, or set the INFSH_API_KEY environment variable for CI/CD and automated workflows.

faq.question: What AI models are available?
faq.answer: The platform offers FLUX, Veo 3.1, Gemini 3 Pro, Claude, Grok, Seedance, OmniHuman, Tavily Search, Exa, and 140+ more models across image, video, text, audio, and other categories.

faq.question: Are there costs associated with using inference.sh?
faq.answer: Some apps are free while others charge based on usage. Check the pricing information for each app using 'infsh app get <app-name>' before running.

faq.question: Can I use this skill without installing the CLI?
faq.answer: No, you must first install the inference.sh CLI by running 'curl -fsSL https://cli.inference.sh | sh' and authenticate with 'infsh login'.

faq.question: How do I discover available apps?
faq.answer: Use 'infsh app list' to see all apps, 'infsh app list --category <category>' to filter by type, or 'infsh app search <query>' to find specific apps.
